com.steelypip.powerups.hydraxml

Class AbsHydraXMLBuilder

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.steelypip.powerups.hydraxml.AbsHydraXMLBuilder
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    HydraXMLBuilder
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    FlexiHydraXMLBuilder

    public abstract class AbsHydraXMLBuilder
extends java.lang.Object
implements HydraXMLBuilder
    This implementation of MinXMLBuilder is maximally flexible:
    • It accepts null element names in startTagOpen, startTagClose and endTag.
    • The startTagClose method may be omitted in the build sequence.
    • After build is called, the builder can be reused.

      • startTag

        public void startTag(java.lang.String field,
                     java.lang.String name,
                     java.lang.Boolean allow_repeats)
        Description copied from interface: HydraXMLBuilder
        This method should be called to begin the construction of a start-tag with a particular element name. When the element is linked to the parent element, the field is used for the link. Name and field may be null, in which case they must be supplied as non-null later. If allow_repeats is specified, repeats are allowed.
        Specified by:
        startTag in interface HydraXMLBuilder
        Parameters:
        field - the field to be used for the link to the parent (or null)
        name - the name of the element to be constructed (or null).

      • startTag

        public void startTag()
        Description copied from interface: HydraXMLBuilder
        This method constructs a startTag with unknown name, field and repeat field. These can be added at any point between the startTag and endTag calls using the bindXXX methods.
        Specified by:
        startTag in interface HydraXMLBuilder

        public void addChild(@Nullable HydraXML x)
        Description copied from interface: HydraXMLBuilder
        This method adds a child to the element under construction. The field name defaults to the value of defaultKey() for the element under construction - which will normally be "".

      • bindName

        public void bindName(@Nullable java.lang.String name)
        Description copied from interface: HydraXMLBuilder
        This method may be called at any time between startTag and endTag in order to provide the name the currently constructing element. If the value of name is null, this method has no effect.
        Specified by:
        bindName in interface HydraXMLBuilder
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the element to be constructed (or null)

      • bindField

        public void bindField(@Nullable java.lang.String field)
        Description copied from interface: HydraXMLBuilder
        This method may be called at any time between startTag and endTag in order to provide the field of the currently constructing element. If the value of field is null, this method has no effect. When the element is linked to the parent element, the field is used for the link.
        Specified by:
        bindField in interface HydraXMLBuilder

      • bindAllowRepeats

        public void bindAllowRepeats(java.lang.Boolean allow_repeats)
        Description copied from interface: HydraXMLBuilder
        This method may be called at any time between startTag and endTag in order to provide the allow_repeats. If it is specified, a repeated field is permitted. If the value is null the method has no effect.
        Specified by:
        bindAllowRepeats in interface HydraXMLBuilder

      • endTag

        public void endTag(java.lang.String name)
        Description copied from interface: HydraXMLBuilder
        This method finishes the construction of the current element. If the tag-name is non-null then it must be in agreement with the previous value. If the previous value is null then it is automatically in agreement.
        Specified by:
        endTag in interface HydraXMLBuilder
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the element to be constructed (or null)

      • endTag

        public void endTag(java.lang.String field,
                   java.lang.String name)
        Description copied from interface: HydraXMLBuilder
        This method finishes the construction of the current element. If the tag-name is non-null then it must be in agreement with the previous value. If the previous value is null then it is automatically in agreement.
        Specified by:
        endTag in interface HydraXMLBuilder
        Parameters:
        field - the field name under which the constructed element will be linked.
        name - the name of the element to be constructed (or null)

      • endTag

        public void endTag(java.lang.String field,
                   java.lang.String name,
                   java.lang.Boolean allow_repeats)
        Description copied from interface: HydraXMLBuilder
        This method finishes the construction of the current element. If the tag-name is non-null then it must be in agreement with the previous value. If the previous value is null then it is automatically in agreement.
        Specified by:
        endTag in interface HydraXMLBuilder
        Parameters:
        field - the field name under which the constructed element will be linked.
        name - the name of the element to be constructed (or null)
        allow_repeats - true if it is OK if there are multiple elements added under this name.
